intro: Vanda rubra, commonly known as the red vanda, is an epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, velvety red flowers with yellow lips, which bloom in clusters during the rainy season. The plant has long, wiry stems and broad,革质 (leathery) leaves that help it retain moisture in its tropical habitat. It thrives in high light conditions and requires well-draining potting media. Vanda rubra is popular among orchid enthusiasts for its vibrant color and relatively easy care requirements.
